Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp-holder with a ribbed conical body with a low-placed carination, and a knob on top. The base is concave. There is a large opening cut in the side for the lamp.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1997)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
